content.question: A free-rider problem exist when

choices.label: a good is excludable in consumption.
a good is nonexcludable in consumption.
a good is rival in consumption.
a good is nonrival in consumption.
a good is in abundant supply.

content.answer: a good is nonexcludable in consumption.

unit.text: 6: Market Failure and the Role of Government

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
